page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
This area of the survey covers the north-western edge of the town of {Barrow-in-Furness}in Cumbria.
Although about{half the block is sea, the land, which includes the northern end of{Walney Island,}and the{Ormsgill &{Sowerby}areas on the mainland, shows a variety of contrasting features.
Ormsgill and Sowerby are a mixture of {industrial, residential & agricultural land, whilst North Walney is largely a {nature reserve,}and has an airfield owned by Vickers Shipbuilders Ltd.
Within this block,{human activity}in Furness can be traced right from {Neolithic}times, (the{archaeological site on Walney) through Barrow's early development, (the Slag Bank, Ormsgill) to modern industrial estates.
